Key Arguments: The proposed bill represents government overreach into personal lives.
It conflicts with international treaties that protect freedom of expression.
The definition of misinformation is too vague and could suppress free speech.
The bill creates a two-tiered legal system, violating the Rule of Law.
Exemptions for government and certain media undermine fairness and equality.
Notable Quotes: What this bill proposes is not only a serious overreach by the government into the personal lives of Australian citizens, but its proposal also directly clashes with several international treaties to which Australia is party.

The vague definition provided by the Proposed Bill could easily be used to prevent Australians from bringing pressing social, cultural, or religious issues to the forefront of society, resulting in the potential suppression of Australian citizens.
The exceptions for specific organisations and/or people create two different laws. There will then be one law for the general population and a separate law for the government and ABC.
